result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant James Andrew Bearer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James Andrew Bearer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James Andrew Bearer was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • James Andrew Bearer was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from Dept of Corrections requesting corrected or amended JOC  / response from Court and reporter

James Andrew Bearer, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel John k Smerlinski.
Craig Nolen appeared as prosecuting attorney. Atty Nolen submits amended information, adding counts 4 and 5. Defendant pleads no contest to counts 3, 4, and 5. On count 3 is entered a 3 year deferred conviction agreement. on count 4 and 5 is 18 months probation on each, consecutive. Costs and costs of supervision, and DNA surcharges on each. Counts 1 and 2 dismissed pursuant to plea agreement.

John k Smerlinski appearing on behalf of defendant by phone means. James Andrew Bearer, defendant does not appear.
Craig Nolen appearing as prosecuting attorney. Defendant will be pleading in, case settled. matter scheduled for plea and sentencing. Trial taken off calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2017 at 11:30 am.

John k Smerlinski appearing on behalf of defendant by phone means. James Andrew Bearer, defendant does not appear.
Craig Nolen appearing as prosecuting attorney. Status on Jury trial and motions. Jury trial status is set for January 11, 12, and 13. Some plea discussions have been made, not resolved yet. 38 person jury panel. Scheduling to stay in place as of yet. Atty Nolen to make scheduling order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Telephone conference on November 14, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Hearing on December 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Order for Change in Bond Conditions filed on 8-3-16 by Atty. Smerlinski.
Stipulation for Change in Bond Conditions filed on 8-3-16 by Atty Smerlinski.

James Andrew Bearer, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel John k Smerlinski.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Jury Trial set for January 11, 12, 13. 12 person jury, 2 alternates, 5 strikes each, 38 jurors. Hearing set for December 20.  Hearing scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

John k Smerlinski appearing on behalf of defendant.
James Andrew Bearer, defendant does not appear.
Gary L. Luhman appearing as prosecuting attorney.
Exhibits 1-17

Violation - Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g); Intent.Dispose Methamphetamine Waste; Knowingly Possess Methamphetamine Waste.  
Issuing Agency - GCSD.
Conditions:  May not leave state of Wisconsin or Green County or Rock County or Dane County without permission of Court.    No contact with residence at N2020 CTH OK in the Town of Spring Grove.
Prohibited from possessing component elements used in the manufacturing of methamphetamine.

James Andrew Bearer, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel John k Smerlinski.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Commenced immediately after Preliminary hearing. Defendant enters Not Guilty pleas on all counts. Set over for DA Pre-trial conference. Bond modified, Defendant allowed to travel to Dane County.

James Andrew Bearer, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel John k Smerlinski.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Atty Luhman calls first witness. Deputy Charles Worm sworn in on oath and testifies. Exhibits marked by DA. Exhibits 1-10 identified. Defendant identified by the witness. Exhibits 11-16 identified. Exhibits 1-16 offered by prosecution and received. Atty Smerlinski cross-examines the witness. Re-direct by Atty Luhman. Bind-over based on the three counts and complaint requested by Atty Luhman. Defense opposes bind-over. Bound over for arraignment, Commences immediately.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.
